qas.question: When did the American cotton industry fail?
What action of the Union damaged the southern cotton exports?
To what county's cotton did European buyers turn due to the American Civil War?
What characteristic of American cotton attracted buyers after the end of the Civil war?
What did the abandonment of Egyptian cotton mean to the Egyptian economy?
When did the Egyptian cotton industry fall?
What action of the Union damaged the French cotton exports?
To what country's cotton did Southern buyers turn due to the American Civil War?
What characteristic of Egyptian cotton attracted buyers after the end of the Civil war?
What did the abandonment of Southern cotton mean to the Egyptian economy?

context: During the <a0_0><b5_0>American Civil War<b5_0/><a0_0/>, American cotton exports slumped due to a <a1_0><b6_0>Union blockade<b6_0/><a1_0/> on Southern ports, and also because of a strategic decision by the Confederate government to cut exports, hoping to force Britain to recognize the Confederacy or enter the war. This prompted the main purchasers of cotton, Britain and France, to turn to <a2_0><b7_0>Egyptian<b7_0/><a2_0/> cotton. British and French traders invested heavily in cotton plantations. The Egyptian government of Viceroy Isma'il took out substantial loans from European bankers and stock exchanges. After the American Civil War ended in 1865, British and French traders abandoned Egyptian cotton and returned to <a3_0><b8_0>cheap<b8_0/><a3_0/> American exports,[citation needed] sending Egypt into a deficit spiral that led to the country declaring <a4_0><b9_0>bankruptcy<b9_0/><a4_0/> in 1876, a key factor behind Egypt's occupation by the British Empire in 1882.
